title: Biden Expected to Tap Zients as White House Coronavirus Coordinator
sub_head: Jeffrey Zients served previously as Obama administration economic adviser
body:
WASHINGTON—President-elect Joe Biden is expected to tap Jeffrey Zients, a former Obama administration economic adviser, for a senior White House role overseeing the administration’s coronavirus response, according to people familiar with the matter.
Mr. Zients is expected to work with senior officials across multiple agencies to coordinate pandemic response efforts, the people said. It couldn’t be learned when Mr. Biden would make the announcement.
Mr. Biden’s transition team declined to comment, and Mr. Zients didn’t immediately respond to a request for comment.
The Democratic president-elect is expected to fill health-care positions in his administration as coronavirus cases continue to surge across the country. The number of Covid-19-related deaths reported in a day hit a record in the U.S. this week, and newly reported infections were at their second highest level, surpassing 200,000 for the second time in less than a week.
Mr. Zients, a business executive, led the National Economic Council during much of then-President Barack Obama’s second term. Before that, he was a senior official and acting director at the White House Office of Management and Budget. He also played a lead role in helping to fix problems with the administration’s health-care website.
